result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry J Ziervogel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 and any other sentence in the House of Correction, credit of 180 days time served.

Sign up for probation no later than 9/16/22.
Probation to be served under ACT 100.
Conditions apply to each Count.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 9/16/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No contact with SJS.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription

- Random UA's.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry J Ziervogel

records.addlTxt: Witness fee request prepared for Karlee R. was approved for 1 appearance on 09/07/22 by the DA's Victim/Witness Services.

Defendant Terry J Ziervogel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared by video for Terry J Ziervogel.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, 4 AND 5:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNTS 6 AND 7:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS concurrent with Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 and any other sentence in the House of Correction, credit of 180 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS concurrent with Counts 1, 3, 4 and 5 and any other sentence in the House of Correction, credit of 180 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS concurrent with Counts 1, 2, 4 and 5 and any other sentence in the House of Correction, credit of 90 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNT 4:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS concurrent with Counts 1, 2, 3, and 5 and any other sentence in the House of Correction, credit of 180 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNT 5:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS concurrent with Counts 1, 2, 3, AND 4 and any other sentence in the House of Correction, credit of 180 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 9/16/22.
- Probation to be served under ACT 100.
- No contact with SJS.
- Random UA's.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 9/16/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Terry J Ziervogel not in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Terry J Ziervogel.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is calendared for jury trial. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Case is passed to address Courts calendar. 

***
Recalled: Same appearances. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Court is in trial on another matter. Attorney Poznanski informs the court that this is now in resolution posture. Court will look for a spin court to hear a plea and sentencing. Case is adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terry J Ziervogel not in court, in custody.  Attorney Will Hotchkiss for Amanda Poznanski in court for Terry J Ziervogel.  Attorney Navjot Hira in court for State of Wisconsin.  SPD Poznanski is unable to appear for the bail bond hearing.  Statements heard.  Matter adjourned to the jury trial date in Branch 15 on 9/7/2022.

Defense counsel Attorney Amanda Poznanski emailed the Court on 8/17/2022 requesting a bail/bond review hearing. Court authorizes scheduling of bail/bond hearing which is set for 09/01/2022 at 9:30 a.m. Parties notified.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Terry J Ziervogel not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial September 7, 2022 at 9:00am, Branch 15.
State's Motion in Limine, filed.
State's Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. 
Expires 9-19-2022

Defendant Terry J Ziervogel in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Terry J Ziervogel in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding his right to appear in person before the Court. Court finds defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to appear in person before the Court and agrees to proceed electronically via Zoom.  Plea negotiations stated on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Court began plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court set dates as requested.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Jury Instructions
Received and Filed:  State's Offer Letter.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Motion and Notice of Motion for Speedy Trial (Terry J. Ziervogel #2022603263 - HOC 8885 S. 68TH Street. Franklin, WI. 53132)

Received and Filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Terry J Ziervogel in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Terry J Ziervogel in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terry J Ziervogel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
